page.title: 18HUDDERSFIELD 47 YEARS AGO
page.content: My friend Michelle and I interviewed my Aunt Alice.From first moving to to Fartown the look of the houses has changed. Some are scruffy and some neat. The same with the gardens. She said that there used to be competitions for the neatest gardens, so people kept their gardens neat and tidy. The banking which used to be a train track was clean with no rubbish on it,as it has now. The field had railings round it but in Wartime these were taken down because soldiers had to cross fields unseen. She said there were more houses now than when she came and the trees had grown a lot. She said she preferred Fartown forty seven years ago because people were friendlier and the place was neater. Boats used to go along the Canal. Now it is all weeds.
